column3: For future reference: Note that you can just git push with `--force` as flag to avoid having to reopen the pull request.

<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->Note to reviewers: This pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* #13716 (bitcoin-cli: -stdinwalletpassphrase and non-echo stdin passwords by kallewoof)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

>This pull request is rebased from #13879\n\nYes, please don't open new PRs for the same thing, but force-push to the old one. Otherwise it splits the discussion over a whole trail of PRs which doesn't make things easier for maintainers.
Please squash your commits according to https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#squashing-commits\n\n(Might as well do a rebase, since there wasn't any review yet)

Output generated using `help2man src/bitcoin-cli`.

master (2115cba):
```
 B\-stdinrpcpass R
.TP
Read RPC password from standard input as a single line.
When combined
.IP
with  B\-stdin R, the first line from standard input is used for the
RPC password.
.HP

```

This PR (869193f):
```
 B\-stdinrpcpass R
.IP
Read RPC password from standard input as a sin

Diff looks good. ACK 869193f5a6398bb9e4a6f4a7aeb8d2203193c80f

```diff
diff --git a/doc/man/bitcoin-cli.1 b/doc/man/bitcoin-cli.1
index 1da4c3aa03..639cc93f4c 100644
--- a/doc/man/bitcoin-cli.1
+++ b/doc/man/bitcoin-cli.1
@@ -75,27 +75,25 @@ Wait for RPC server to start
 .HP
  B\-rpcwallet= R<walletname>
 .IP
 Send RPC for non\-default wallet on RPC server (needs to exactly
There is a `.  ` in this line as well. What makes it work here and not below?
You're right (and I didn't catch it). But somehow help2man parses badly only the second line.
@MarcoFalke more precisely: the `FormatParagraph` call makes `-stdin` option output _without_ two spaces between words; that's why help2man parses it without any issue.
